According to a WikiLeak( ed) US diplomatic cable, titled` Presidential Succession in Egypt', dated May 14, 2007: `` Egyptian intelligence chief and Hosni Mubarak consigliere, in past years Soliman was often cited as likely to be named to the long-vacant vice-presidential post. In the past two years, Soliman has stepped out of the shadows, and allowed himself to be photographed, and his meetings with foreign leaders reported. Many of our contacts believe that Soliman, because of his military background, would at least have to figure in any succession scenario. From 1993 until Saturday, Omar Suleiman was chief of Egypt's Colin Powell Intelligence Service. He remained largely in the shadows until 2001, when he started taking over powerful dossiers in the foreign ministry; he

Green Bay 27. The call from the sideline was for a play in which all four wide receivers on the field sprinted for the end zone.`` Four verticals,'' Michael Vick said. Michael Vick pumped[ a fake] inside and threw outside, Reid said.

Eric Schmidt , who previously had been Novell CEO and Sun CTO, has been the public face of Google with his calm, relaxed demeanor, while running the company as a`` triumvirate'' with Page and Sergey Brin . Having Eric Schmidt as the front of Google has been tremendous for Google, and there is no doubt that bringing his perspective has been critical for good decision-making at the company, IDC analyst Al Hilwa said via e-mail. Some wondered if Page is up to the mammoth task of running such a large, powerful and increasingly diverse company.`` I guess the question is whether being Google CEO

long as it produces results soon, Wes Miller said.`` You can play pin the blame on the donkey, but the reality is Steve Ballmer has to accept some of the blame,'' he said. He also has to put the right people in the right places. -- Editors: Nick Turner , Tom Giles To contact the reporter on this story: Dina Bass in Seattle at dbass2@bloomberg.net

market share, Stephen Elop has held talks with Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer about putting Microsoft's mobile operating system on Nokia phones, said the person, who asked not to be identified because the discussions were private. The market expects Nokia to announce adoption of Windows Phone 7 either for the high-end or for some geographies( U.S.), Morgan Stanley analysts including Patrick Standaert wrote in a report this week. Whatever Stephen Elop chooses to do,`` execution will be key,'' they wrote. Laurie Armstrong, a U.S. spokeswoman for Espoo, Finland
